text:
The second floor of the building was a total tavern scene. All the windows were wide open, and it looked packed. You could hear singing, clarinets, violins, and even a Turkish drum booming. Women were shrieking, and Raskolnikov was about to turn back, questioning why he even came to X. Prospect. 

Then, out of nowhere, he spotted Svidrigaïlov at an open window, chilling at a tea table with a pipe. Raskolnikov was shocked—almost scared. Svidrigaïlov was just sitting there, watching him, and it seemed like he wanted to sneak away unnoticed. 

Raskolnikov pretended he didn’t see him, trying to look casual while keeping an eye on Svidrigaïlov. His heart was racing. It was clear Svidrigaïlov didn’t want to be spotted. He pulled the pipe from his mouth and looked like he was about to hide. But then, just as he got up and moved his chair, he realized Raskolnikov was watching him.

Their interaction felt a lot like their first meeting in Raskolnikov’s room. A sly smile crept onto Svidrigaïlov’s face, getting bigger as they both acknowledged each other. Finally, Svidrigaïlov burst into laughter. 

“Alright, come in if you want to talk; I’m right here!” he called from the window. 

Raskolnikov headed into the tavern. He found Svidrigaïlov waiting.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov encounters Svidrigaïlov at a tavern, feeling a mix of terror and intrigue as their eyes meet.
